items.sentence: I kept on looking for my keys even though I didn't really expect to find them.
Tom wanted to buy some notebooks and pens. He also wanted to buy other things.
Let's talk about ways that we might prevent this from happening in the future.
Tom quit his job as a corporate lawyer and decided to travel around the world.
Statistics suggest that the population of this town will double in five years.
I need an envelope and a piece of paper. I also need either a pencil or a pen.
Tom left food and water for his dog, hoping it would be enough for three days.
My teacher told me that I should've spent more time preparing my presentation.
I envy the way that Tom is able to get people to seriously consider his ideas.
I don't understand French, but it's one of the languages that I want to learn.
You don't have to worry about picking me up at the airport. I'll take the bus.
Tom's red-headed wife wondered why there was a long blonde hair on his jacket.
The future is not looking bright from the perspective of many people under 30.
As for me, I'm not satisfied with the result of the examination the other day.
I was born in Boston but moved to Chicago with my parents when I was thirteen.
The long drought followed by weeks of rain caused some of Tom's crops to fail.
In all my travels, I've never seen a more beautiful mountain than Mt. Everest.
I'll leave a key with my next-door neighbour in case you get here before I do.
I'm sorry, but I can't accept your invitation. I have other plans on that day.
I regret to say that the product you have asked for is currently out of stock.
